thread.title: Lazydays RV Customizes State-of-the-Art Bucs Vision Mobile to Support Glazer Family Foundation Outreach Efforts
thread.title_full: Lazydays RV Customizes State-of-the-Art Bucs Vision Mobile to Support Glazer Family Foundation Outreach Efforts

author: Tamara Joseph
title: Lazydays RV Customizes State-of-the-Art Bucs Vision Mobile to Support Glazer Family Foundation Outreach Efforts
text:
Lazydays , the RV Authority, has worked with the Tampa Bay Buccaneers to customize a brand new Bucs Vision Mobile, which will visit local schools to provide students with critical vision services. “We are honored to contribute to a cause that is so key to children’s development in our area; their very vision,” said Lazydays Chief Executive Officer Tim Sheehan. “This was a chance for many of our team members to contribute their skills and talents in such a meaningful way.”
Some details of the project include:
Lazydays customized a 2015 Forest River Georgetown motorhome, and Lazydays on-site customization crews thoroughly renovated the interior space for medical equipment and to give children a great experience. Lazydays craftsmen teamed up to customize the woodwork, fixtures and infrastructure.
A full, artistic vehicle wrap, featuring a larger-than-life image of Buccaneers Pro Bowl Defensive Tackle Gerald McCoy.
To help prepare drivers, Lazydays provided driver training, as well as a thorough tutorial walk-through on the proper use and maintenance of all of the RV components.
A fun, interactive mobile eye clinic for children, the Bucs Vision Mobile visits 60 Title I elementary schools in Hillsborough and Pinellas counties each year to assist with vision screenings and administer eye exams. In 2014 alone, the Vision Mobile provided more than 1,800 pairs of free eyeglasses to Tampa Bay-area youth. Since the program’s inception in 2009, the Bucs Vision Mobile has screened over 10,000 children and by the end of this season will have given out more than 9,000 pairs of eyeglasses.
Founded in Tampa in 1976 – the same year that the Buccaneers franchise was awarded to the region – Lazydays has grown to offer customers the largest selection of new and pre-owned RV brands in the nation.
As part of a larger partnership with the Buccaneers, Lazydays will showcase its RVs on game days in the new Lazydays RV Tailgating Lot, the first dedicated on-site parking location specifically designed for Buccaneers game day RV traffic. There, fans will enjoy a fun and exciting tailgating experience that includes interactive activities and contests.
ABOUT LAZYDAYS
Lazydays ®, founded in 1976, is the world’s largest RV dealership. Based on 126 acres outside Tampa, FL since 1996 and over 30 acres in Tucson, AZ since 2011, Lazydays has the largest selection of RV brands in the nation. Lazydays features nearly 300 service bays, more than 1,400 new and pre-owned RVs, and 2 onsite campgrounds with over 700 RV campsites. Lazydays has built its reputation on providing an outstanding customer experience with exceptional service and product expertise, and as a place to rest and recharge with other RVers. More than a quarter million RVers and their families visit Lazydays every year, making it “their home away from home.” Lazydays has been recognized as a “Top 50 RV Dealer” by RV Business and as one of Tampa Bay’s “Top Work Places.” The Lazydays Employee Foundation, supported by payroll contributions from over 60% of Lazydays’ employees, has contributed more than one million dollars to make many historic changes for at-risk children in the Tampa Bay and Tucson communities. For most people, Lazydays isn't just the beginning of their journey; it's very much a part of their ride. To learn more, visit http://www.lazydays.com .
